intro: Crotalaria dissitiflora subsp. benthamiana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved crownflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions.
